duties_responsibilities.duty: Establish communication and coordination across a data center region’s general contractors, stakeholders, and internal teams.
Develop and maintain a tracking system for design changes, RFI’s (requests for information), and change orders and dashboard and track this information for regional leadership review.
Requesting and reviewing MOPs (Method of Procedure) for proper detail, necessity, and risk.
Onboarding new vendors for badging and orientation.
Updating project management software with milestone dates, correspondence, and documents.
Monitor delivery of owner furnished material to site.
Compiling and storing construction data from vendors.
Managing checklist including various checklists including substantial completion checks, safety, and quality.
Help to ensure monthly Billing and Pay Applications are correct.
Help to manage and implement new processes as required.
Provide daily support to the onsite construction managers in dealing with the many moving parts of a construction project.
Help manage the AWS change order process for all inflight activities and work daily with the general contractors Superintendents and Project Engineers to help keep the project on schedule.
Reduce cost, shorten the duration of delivery, and minimize defects in Data Center Builds.
Bring the job in at or below budget, on schedule, and with Zero Defects at Power Facilities Hand-Off.
Continuously deliver innovative, cost-effective, just in time Data Center capacity for global customers.

education_certification.credential: A four-year degree in a technical field such as engineering, construction management, or a trade school OR 4+ years of related construction experience in lieu of a degree.
